Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthVan83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel at the end of March and beginning of April. Clean hotel. Staff could be more helpful. I would say the small bathroom in our Ron could use a better clean up and toiletries definitely do by get replenished. Overall the room was quite small and a three person stay meant my sister slept on a pullout couch, which is hardly a comfortable sleep. This also meant absolutely no room for our luggage. We played Terris when erring anything out of our bags and moving around the room. No fan in the barroom. The hotel lobby was but the only two internet computers in the lobby meant paying for wifi if you wished to check email. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk from alexanderplatz and about 30 minutes walk from the Brandenburg Gate. Would stay again if we only required a 2 person room.

Reviews.Title: “All round average- terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Elibellie
Reviews.Content: Beds where made of foam which made for a bad night sleep. Location is ok, however not really close to much. Would take a 10min walk at least, however very close to the train. Had dinner one night in the restaurant and it was ok. Staff in my opinion didn't speak or understand very god English, however passable: would probably look to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great breakfast, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: totality
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 for five nights. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful on several occasions - how to get around Berlin, how to get a decaf cappucino at the breakfast buffet and so on. The hotel is located close to subway station Spittelmarkt, which makes exploring the city quite easy. The breakfast buffet was great - not gourmet food, but plenty of food for carnivores & vegetarians, for savory and sweet snacking people. Rooms are standard Novotel fare, nothing to write home about. Ours was on the 7th floor and tended to get quite warm - air conditioning (loud) as well as open windows (street traffic) decreased our sleep quality, but it is hard to find a hotel without these problems in Berlin. Would recommend this hotel definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Marvelous breakfast, friendly personel, Rooms where not always cleaned very thoroughly and necessities not always supplied. Very near to the underground and although near a busy road ,no traffic disturbance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and fantastic breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Bruce3188
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The location is very good, within 200 meters of the underground and close to many of the historic sites in Berlin. Rooms are modern and large, with a shower and bath. Only complaint is the rooms are very warm even with the zircon completey off. We paid 116 Euro per night which I consider great value. Breakfast was included and is the best variety buffet I've seen. The bar is affordable. We did not eat in the restaurant for dinner, but had a nice salad as a snack in the bar. Well set up for multi night stays and seemed very child friendly

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice !”
Reviews.Author: LynTUk
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a very good location. We have now stayed here 4 times on visits to Berlin and tha standards are always high.Wouldnt stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Five nights in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Madaboutafrica
Reviews.Content: A five night stay....booked through Expedia. It was a real bargain !! The hotel was super a lovely room ( 2 adults and 2 children sharing) with ensuite. Super breakfast worthy of 5 *!! Helpful staff at desk and great internet aceess!! Great location to museums Brandenburg gate and tube.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea8521
Reviews.Content: stayed in that hotel only for 1 night, have to say thank you for your very friendly staff. was very happy that it was so easy to get early check in, excellent communication. Room was very clean, comfortable bed, modern bathroom with the bath, shower accessories, soft towels, etc.. Room service delivery took only 20 min and food was delicious. This hotel has very good location and only few minutes from subway. If I would fly again to Berlin this hotel will be on my list as No1 :)

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: surrideo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in January 2012. My room was very clean, had everything I needed and the bed was comfortable. The location was great for work and also for the leisure time I spent in the city after. The people that work in this hotel are friendly and efficient. They went out of their way to make my stay a success for which I am very grateful. Breakfast was good with a selection of hot and cold food. There are two macs in reception that provide free internet access. Everyone spoke English and without exception they were very kind about my grasp of German - what impeccable manners ! The hotel coped well with the great increase in guests it had over the weekend. I will be back in Berlin and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: Docvini
Reviews.Content: Rooms = Very clean, confortable and hygenic with all modern facilities, typical of all Novotel i have stayed, good bed to sleep. Bathroom = Nice Shower, good towels and accessories, clean and hygenic. Breakfast = Buffet with various options in continental food, as I am for India, some more hot breakfast options would have been welcome. Location = Hotel is with in the city, taxi can be very expensive to take shuttle (need to change) for airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: EduardoSteiner
Reviews.Content: very good restaurant (I tried breakfast, lunch and dinner), very friendly staff and well located (10 min walking to Alexander Platz). For sure, I will return to this hotel next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Location and cleanliness, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Penelope G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and close to most major sites. It's also very close to a U-Bahn station and bus stops, which is always helpful. The staff were unfriendly, sometimes rude, and not particularly helpful. On the plus side, after we complained about the unacceptable state of the pullout couch's mattress (what's considered their triple room) the problem was dealt with the same day and we received a letter of apology and complimentary chocolates from the hotel. The walls in this hotel must be paper-thin, because we could hear the TV on in other rooms, children screaming, and stomping any time we were in the room. The breakfast was overpriced at 18 euro. (Hint: there's a supermarket less than half-a-block away where you can pick up most of what is offered at a fraction of the price. The room has a mini-bar that can be used to refrigerate any perishables.) We dined at the restaurant on our first night...one time too many. The food was barely edible and overpriced. I've had better meals on the side of the road in India! The wait staff's behaviour was appalling. Wifi was an additional charge of 9 euro for 24 hours. The two courtesy computers in the lobby were constantly being used by young children playing games or on social media sites. This is particularly frustrating when you would like to quickly check flights, routes to attractions or make dinner reservations. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. You can easily find a more reasonably priced hotel in the same location (i.e. Motel One). Quite disappointing considering Novotel is a well-known chain often associated with high-quality hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service & value for money”
Reviews.Author: AxelR0695
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and helped us at any time we needed. I was also very happy to find that it is only a 10 minutes walk to the Museum island (where 3 key museums are). Great hotel, I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel perfectly located and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel with 2 children, sleeping with 4 persons in 1 room. the room was not very big, but big enough for us and clean. also a little fridge, good bathroom. from the hotel you can walk easily to for example alexanderplats, berlin mitte, unter den linden or potsdamer platz. 2 underground stations very close to the hotel (märkisches museum and spittelmarkt). near the hotel is a supermarket, a pharmacy, a coffee corner and a drugstore and an indian restaurant shezan, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas Ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the third time in a row. Loved the hospitality the cleanliess. Children were welcomed and felt like they were home. Breakfast is wonderful. The hotel is located near many places of interest and there is bus stop just outside so anyone can walk or travel by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro station and Bus stop”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. I could walk to Berlin Cathedral and Alexander Platz. It takes 3 minutes walk from the hotel to Metro station, Spittelmarkt (U2 line). There are also bus stops near the hotel (2-3 minutes walk) and you can take the line M48. You can go to Alexander Platz and Posdam Platz by both this Metro and Bus. There is also a small supermarket at the corner of the street whete the hotel is located. It opens from 8 till 21 from Monday to Saturday. It was convenient to buy warter there. It was a pity that there is no free WIFI at the hotel. The fee is EUR3.00 for 1 hour, EUR6.00 for 5 hours and EUR9.00 for 24 hours. The service was very good. The waiter at the bar was very kind and friendly. I would love to stay there again if I have a chance to visit Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Short winter break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well placed in middle of East Berlin. Most sight seeing places easily accessable. Food was good and rooms spacious and clean. Staff made us feel welcome and offered to help wherever possible, Would visit again and likely stop in the same hotel.,

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giulio984
Reviews.Content: We were happy with this hotel. It’s very business oriented, meaning clean design, elegant, practical and well-served, but not very cozy. The position is quite good, five minutes walking from the subway. The rooms are confortable and clean, with a very big window. We did not have breakfast here but the last night we tried the restaurant and it was very good. Peaceful and with a nice atmosphere. No free wifi, you have to go downstairs in the hall to use internet, which I think, today, is quite a problem. Although the waiters were very nice the reception staff could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “It was great to be back!”
Reviews.Author: nemrac9
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel many years ago, just after the opening, there were no second thoughts about staying there again. Through Expedia we got a great flight & hotel deal. We arrived early and had to get the attention of the receptionist who was busy with other things. This was the only downfall as the 'welcome' was not warm or welcoming at all. The remainder of the stay was pleasant; the staff were friendly and helpful; we asked for slippers and gowns which were delivered swiftly and with a smile! The room was clean and even though the hotel room is very standard without much charm, it was exactly what we wanted. We had an 'inner-facing' room, which at first we were a little disappointed of, but it turned out to be a lot quieter enabling us to sleep late. We did not make use of the restaurant at all this time, but I am certain that the breakfast buffet is still as good as it used to. The location is absolutely ideal; a few minutes walk from the Alexander Platz and Potsdamer Platz. A few years back, the TXB bus stopped a few meters away from the hotel - to my disappointment, the route has since changed, but it is still easy to get to the hotel. I am happy that we chose to stay at the Novotel Berlin Mitte again and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good ,functional hotel . Staff were friendly and very welcoming. Room was located facing an inner courtyard and we could hear none of the traffic from the main road. Hotel is well located, U-Bahn Spittlemarkt just 2 mins walk away and buses pass by regularly. Many of the main sights are within ten minutes walk from the hotel but we found that we kept going and ended up at the Brandenburger Tor.Alexanderplatz and Nikolaiviertel are also very close. The only negatives I would have are that the room we stayed in seemed much smaller to the one we stayed in when using the Novotel in Munich (booked for 2 adults and 1 child) and secondly, there was a very limited number of English speaking channels available on the TV. Again, in the Munich Novotel we had an option to pay for movies in English and I was surprised that this is not an option across all Novotels. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, but functions very well!”
Reviews.Author: RHPrague
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, no frills chain hotel. Well situated 2 mins from Spittalmarkt metro, and 15 minutes walk to Gendarmemarkt. Fairly spartan but comfortable room, good but expensive breakfast, no extra facilities, but some very good prices are available. The staff are a big plus, efficient and unfailingly friendly on both visits. This time one of them even lent me his own Iphone charger. If you want a straightforward hotel that lets you get on with enjoying Berlin, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sanny07
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a family weekend or mid-week city trip. Rooms are standard and ours was a bit tight for the four of us, but the breakfast was excellent. There was a wide choice of foods and service was very good. The location is great, just a few minutes' walk from an underground station and within walking distance of a lot of the major sights. Although on a busy road, our room was very quiet. Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly even though the hotel was fully booked when we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vk167
Reviews.Content: It is well located, close to the spittel market U bahn station. About two stops away from Alexanderplatz. The family rooms are nice and spacious. The staff was courteous and friendly. The breakfast though good was expensive. On the whole, I will recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel let down by rude staff member”
Reviews.Author: Jackal2221
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel because of the location and comfort but our checkin experience spoiled an otherwise pleasant stay. The male staff member on duty late in the evening was obnoxious to say the least. The other staff members were extremely professional and apologetic and gave us free parking as a way to placate us. Overall the hotel was good but they need to replace the guy on reception who clearly has no customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: SidCupLondon
Reviews.Content: Nicely situated, usual excellent Novotel breakfast. Staff keen to help even if their advice on getting a train to Schonefeld Airport varied considerably. Next to a dual carriageway but incredibly quiet in the rooms. Nice restaurants nearby. Spittelmarkt u-bahn very near too but so much within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality hotel with some serious issues to sort out”
Reviews.Author: Foss
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel in a good location to explore Berlin and within 10/15 mins walking distance of Alexanderplatz. Our room was pretty standard, but was comfortable and had all we needed and was very clean. We had an inside room facing a courtyard, which meant all was very quiet and the curtains were of the black out type and blocked out the light well.The bed was firm and very comfortable and the air con worked quietly - all making for a very good night's sleep. Breakfast was excellent - brilliant choice and excellent quality. It was very busy, but was very well organised and the queue was seated very quickly by a very helpful and friendly lady. Tables were also kept well cleared of debris and food was constantly and promptly replenished. In fact, it was one of the best run hotel breakfast rooms I have experienced. Service in the bar was also very friendly and efficient and there was a nice atmosphere. Sadly however, there were serious issues with some of our bookings and with Reception. One couple in our group of friends were unceremoniously told on arrival in the late evening that the hotel was very busy and over booked and they would have to move to a 'sister hotel' and another couple in our party were not allocated the twin-bedded room which had been reserved directly on the phone with the hotel. In both cases the member of staff on Reception was unacceptably unpleasant in his attitude and handling of the problem, which made the initial problems so much worse. I must stress that all other members of staff were superb in their attitude and did their very best to placate our friends. It is just a pity that they were let down so badly by their colleague. Also, although we had asked for a Non Smoking Room, an ash tray in the room,the smell of smoke sometimes in the corridor and through the vent in the bathroom (??!!) and the absence of a 'No Smoking' sign did made me wonder. So, two areas for improvement : the allocation of rooms process and the attitude of certain members of Reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstading breakfast”
Reviews.Author: crisbet23
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Novotel in october 2011. Great 4 star hotel. Excellent room, good location for the museums, Unter den Linden, and close to a U-bahn station, just a few stops from Alexanderplatz. Excellent breakfast buffet (expensive, but worth it); they also have a small breakfast option, cheaper. No free wireless, but free internet on the hotel's Mac computers at the lobby. Would definetely stay there again, as well as at another Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with this hotel. Good sized functional rooms and efficient and friendly service. The location is good, walking distance to Alexander Platz and easily accessible from the U-Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knutinho
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Novotel, partly for business, partly to see the sights in Berlin. Positive: Very conveniently located for the museums, Unter den Linden, and close to a U-bahn station. Excellent breakfast buffet. Nice room (ours was a "superior"). Free wireless. Negative: Slow check-in (but friendly). Confusion regarding breakfast included/excluded, not corrected even after second night. Air conditioning not very effective (turned off because summer is over?) And I hate plastic mattress covers under the sheets!

Reviews.Title: “Superbly managed hotel in Museum Island”
Reviews.Author: cristinebarbu
Reviews.Content: Novotel is one of my favourite hotel brands. And Novotel in Berlin was no exception. Beside, the personnel was extremely polite and helpful. Very good breakfast, really comfortable and clean nice rooms, and an excellent location. Very pleased about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 4 nights to visit IFA 2011. There are several good points such as good location, quiet environment, super market is close, friendly staff and good restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. TV system was a little tricky to operate but once could know it, there was no problem. Room is good enough for one person. Internet access was fast enough although I have to pay for the service separately, but in Berlin where many sightseeing travelers who don't use internet it will be reasonable. I could not find any negative point including room rate at the term of IFA 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Fair enough”
Reviews.Author: Proffnerd
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Mitte is an ordinary, run-of-the-mill hotel. It's a little out of the way of Alexanderplatz and Hackescher Markt, but you can walk to both places in ten minutes - give or take. My room was boring, but functional and clean. I had a room for disabled people and so there was a lot of empty floorspace and no shower walls or curtains. Breakfast was good and service was fully acceptable. Happily the AC worked well so I could chill the room at night. In summary: Unspectacular, but good value and it delivered exactly what it promised.

Reviews.Title: “The Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: stephanie m
Reviews.Content: The front desk is the first encounter a traveler has upon arrival to their destination-in this case- Novotel Berlin Mitte. We traveled a long distance. Upon arrival to the front desk to check in to our room, we were told- no, you won't be checking into the room because there is no room open, it's Sunday, people stay in their rooms all day, maybe until 5:00 early eve- we should come back later. This message was delivered to us with a hint of glee,sarcasm, and joy! We would have liked to have regrouped and been able to lie down for a while, but of course began our "sightseeing"-our vacation. We came back several hours before 5:00 and 2 rooms were available. Although I won't out this rude gentleman- I would give kudos to Steven. He was your best male front desk/concierge.

Reviews.Title: “A central location walking distance to the key sights of Berlin and public transport”
Reviews.Author: vallju Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided an excellent buffet breakfast and bar area to relax in, the staff were extremely helpful and the room and bathroom was to what I have come to expect in a ACCOR Novotel property. Lots of families were also frequenting the hotel, initially I was given a room when we checked in very lateen the evening, the next morning I explained with the windows open as over reception a bit noisy, they very kindly moved our stuff to a quiet room on a higher floor facing away from the road and reception whilst we were on tour. This hotel is suitable to all travelers whether for a short or longer stay. We taxed from the train station given our late arrival however a underground was very close along with many restaurants, supermarkets and a great little Irish pub about 100 m up and across road.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: monymontana
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in mitte, short walking distance from metro station and other attractions around, rooms are average size, very clean, and overall we were very satisfied with this hotel also the night price wasn't very expensive comparing to this hotel, i do recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good localization within Berlim”
Reviews.Author: GaspaFer
Reviews.Content: Good enough to stay a par of days in Berlim. The service is average and the breakfast is also good enough. In my next stay in Berlim I'll try to find another option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: SebastianLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five days in August 2011. The hotel is attractive and clean, with very good rooms. Well located, close to all kinds of interesting things, although if you arrive and don't know Berlin, it may look as if you are in the middle of nowhere. Don't worry, you're not. The personnel is extremely friendly, we got all kinds of help and even free coffee and croissants one day. Can't praise the reception people enough, The only two drawbacks are the following: (a) If breakfast is not included in your room rate, it's way too expensive. Don't have breakfast at the hotel, walk 200 m and you'll find nice and cheaper places. (Don't even think about a little breakfast place around the corner... it's as expensive as the hotel. Pass that place and continue walking); (b) There are bit two computers for guests to use in the reception area. This should be enough (actually, there should be internet access in the rooms) but very often those computers are taken over by children, who spend hours playing with them. Perhaps the hotel should consider restricting use of those computers to grown-ups, who have to do urgent things like checking in for their fights. Children do have a games console in the lobby, so they don't need two additional computers. All in all, and apart from these two minor objections, a very nice hotel at a very attractive price. I'll use it again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: tangks
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the nice price we could get for 2 adults and 2 children. The location is really top, you can go to every sightseeing location within minutes! You can see the Fernsehturm through the windows (which we got) and some other buildings. The breakfast was quite tasty, but a bit more variation would have been better :). The carpark was a bit too expensive, but it gave safe impression at least. At the lobby the have 2 internet pc's you can use for free, but with a time limit of 20 minutes, they also have a Xbox360 with a Cars' game for the kids. The rooms were quite well ordened and clean. It was quite modern, the airconditioning was a bit loud, but not too loud to sleep. There is a LCD tv with tons of channels to watch. If we go to Berlin again we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in great city!”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in May 2011. From the airport we took a train\metro to the hotel, it took us about 1 hour to reach the hotel. The metro station is a few minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was rather big. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel since the price is a little bit expensive. There is nice caffe at the same building where we had breakfast. The supermarket is also very close. We walked a lot and only use metro to reach Kurfürstendamm (shopping street)

Reviews.Title: “business center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Berlin very much, I feel you need to address the computer facilities in the Hotel. There are only two computers available and as this is a family friendly Hotel most of the time it was difficult to check emails as the young perople were constantly using the computers for facebook. I am not sure what the solution is but these are my observation. We hope to return to Berlin as it is a great city and we would most certainly stay with you again,

Reviews.Title: “we had a pleasant stay everything was perfect "EXELLENT'”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my family used this hotel every time we visit berlin .we have always good time there .Im using the hotel for the last five years and, i did not think once to stay in other hotel , also i recomended this hotel to a friends and everybody had a good time stay there. "Exellent' is the word that descripes the services in the hotel .thank you for a pleasant stay this summer.All your stuff are profesionals and very polite . The rooms are clean and pleasant to be in . The transportation from the hotel to any place in the city is very easy by bus or by a taxi, we mostly used the buses to the town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect base for exploring Berlin; very cental location yet calm surroundings, easy carparking and less that two minutes walk away from underground station. Our room was superclean and spacy enough. Staff was as friendly, skilled and helpful as one could ask for. Good value for the money spent!

Reviews.Title: “worked very well for us”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowScotty
Reviews.Content: modern hotel with good central location, walking distance to cathedral, museums, subway stations, etc. The Nikolai quarter nearby has restaurants and bars. We stayed five days and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable family hotel with some minor disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Berlin Mitte in July of 2011. The hotel offered a good deal for two nights and the location was close to the address where I had a business meeting. Finding a route to the hotel entrance was slightly difficult, since there were no visible signs on the street (besides the HOTEL sign on the wall). The staff at the front desk was very kind and our children received complimentary backbags with surprises inside. Our room was small, but with two decent king-size beds, no extras and the bath room woul need some minor repairs. We tried to get some breakfast on both mornings, but at 09:00 the lines were so long that we decided to skip hotel breakfast and go to nearby cafe's instead. There are several cafes within 10 minutes walking distance. The location in Mitte is ok, if you are ready to walk about 15 minutes to various sights, such as the TV tower, Checkpoint Charlie, Humboldt University etc.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Berlin Center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very good value for money, great location. the service is good and efficient. Spacious clean room. If you visit Berlinstay here. We stayed only 6 night but only because of our itinerary. If I am back in BerlinI will choose it again

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: SusanneB65
Reviews.Content: Booked it in an Expedia deal. We booked a superior room and were initially given a standard but once pointed out, that was rectified without a problem. A bit of a conference hotel but it worked well for us on a long culture-vulture weekend in Berlin. Very central in Berlin-Mitte and only 2 min to the tube Spittelmarkt. Lots of sights to see nearby and a few decent restaurants and cafes nearby as well. The room was nice with comfortable beds and the windows are very soundproof. We skipped the expensive hotel breakfast and went to the little cafe round the corner. Shame that internet access in the room costs extra. Would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Patricia_Barna Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had already stayed at a Novotel hotel in Berlin in a previous business trip and was very satisfied with the service so I when I planned to go back to Berlin, this time on a leisure trip, I searched for the same hotel or related ones and I found an incredible offer to stay in the Novotel Mitte which is very conveniently located. I immediately recommended it to friends who also planned to visit Berlin and they were equally delighted with the incredible offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located typical Novotel for reconnoitering Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MarcLeuven_Belgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights when visiting Berlin. The hotel is within walking distance from all the main sights and museums of the Museum Insel and just outside the hotel (5 minute walk) is a metro stop for excursions farther afield (Spittelmarkt stop). Alexander Platz is also just a walk away so a trip to the Fernseh tower is very pleasant and easy. Restaurants abound in the area so you won't go hungry but if you feel like eating in the hotel itself, we found the food extremely decent and the service very friendly. The bar of the hotel remains open until a little past midnight and it's a pleasant place to watch the busy trafic outside and discuss the discoveries of the day. The rooms do not ooze with personality as they are the typical Novotel rooms. They are efficient and comfortable but rather devoid of charm. We got a room that looked out at the inner courtyard behind the hotel. Keep in mind that the hotel has airconditioning but that it is hardly ever switched on. It was above 30 degrees during our stay but the aircon wasn't switched on at time. In that sense it may be a good idea idea to ask for a room away from the street so that you can open the window for fresh air without being annoyed by the traffic in front of the hotel. Also don't forget to bring mosquito repellent in that case. Parking is available in the hotel's parking garage but against payment of a daily fee. All in all a decent hotel for discovering Berlin. Not bursting with personality but you can find that anywhere outside in the city anyway.

Reviews.Title: “all good except few people of the staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is excellent... great value for money.... location is good, easy connectivity... rooms are great.... my only problem was the staff.... very unfriendly and not so helpful... apart from that all is fantastic.... would surely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Berlin July 11”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the staff are very efficient and friendly. The hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable. But when I made my reservation I specifically requested a room away from the lifts as I know form experience how noisy it is near the lifts. I was given a room right opposite the lift. In the early morning I was woken up by small children playing in the area in front of the lift, in the late evening I was woken by drunken guests returning from parties. The hotel lobby is a mess, more like a kindergarten than a hotel. Guests do not ecpect to enter a 4 star hotel and have small children running around playing football. The children's play area should be moved somewhere more private. The hotel manager must decide whether this is a business hotel or a kindergarten.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel and Services”
Reviews.Author: mel7155
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 12 noon and had to leave our luggage at the luggage area as check in time was 3pm. Found that the receptionist was condescending by saying that we are unaware that the check in time is 3 pm. Also, as we left our luggage at the luggage room, the porter/ employee expected us to lug our luggage on our own to the luggage room as well as to lug our luggage up to our room on our own. I don't experience this in Accor hotels in Asia or is this a German thing? Location is i a quiet district so there is no nightlife hence grab your meals outside before coming back to hotel. Subway - Spittemarket i think is 300m away but that means lugging luggage up stairs in the subway. If you are coming from the airport- better to hire taxi rather than lug your luggage along all those steps in all the berlin subway station. If staying in berlin again, will not tay at this hotel due to the mechanical service. P.S: I find this strange but is there some specialised division of labour in this hotel? If you want a table- someone does that only, if you want to order food- another person will do it, information on berlin- that is the job of person C only, sent the luggage on your own to luggage room- job of person d, call a cab- you guess itt- that is the job of person e. Can be fun for some but highly frustrating for others

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel! Perfect location! Near from a metro station and Alexanderplatz. Staff was very kind. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Delicius breakfast. Definitely, would stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Utmärkt, sehr gut, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Conneli
Reviews.Content: Very good location. God service, nice breakfast. Clean and good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ... I wish all hotels would be like this one!”
Reviews.Author: FlavioPA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, very good breakfast, great for family and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great overall”
Reviews.Author: ThePreggersPlan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Novotel Berlin Mitte for 4 nights. We found the hotel to be spacious, clean, and comfortable. We found that the staff spoke English very well, was friendly, and very helpful. The hotel also provided two computers with free internet in the lobby. The location of the hotel is amazing! It is an easy (perhaps 1/2 mile) walk to Museum Island. It is also just across the bridge from a small block of restaurants in the former Medieval quarter. Additionally, public transportation is extremely convenient. There is a subway stop only a block away and there are several buses that run down the street in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: helbe137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a weekend to Berlin in april 2011, the room was very big and nice moderd furnited, but some things seem to be broken, like the sink in the bathroom. The staff was nice and helpful except when we had some problem with the TV, about 100 channels, all german. We had a special rate for Accor-member so we found it very good value for our money, we did not eat the breakfast buffet, in Berlin it's much nicer to go out on a café in the morning. Be aware of the hotel is located close to a big road, if you think traffic noise is very annoying I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Vactions, Bad for Business”
Reviews.Author: StratManLou
Reviews.Content: Good family hotel but not a business hotel. Caters more to family hostings than to business stays. The breakfast line is a nightmare especially on weekends.. you need to eat early like 0630. Staff is attentive and deserves credit when things get crowded

Reviews.Title: “Central location and good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: RAECambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my two children (aged 11 and 12) for 3 nights at the beginning of April. It is very centrally located for all the major sights. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Our room had a sofa bed for the children plus my own double. There was plenty of space. Although the hotel is on a busy road, there was little noise from the traffic. We all slept very well. I would definately stay here again and would reccomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: .....as long as you don't expect a u-bahn station next door. The hotel is on Fischer island: pretty central to the city but slightly away from the hot-spots e.g. potsdammer platz/ alexanderplatz. So be prepared for a leisurely stroll to the city. Traffic noise wasn't too bad, and no trams passing made it a little more relaxing. Breakfast was historically good for the price :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Stayed for a leisure visit to Berlin, very friendly and helpful staff, clean, well appointed rooms, not fancy but met all of our needs. Location is within walking distance of many sights and near U stop. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably priced option halfway to everything”
Reviews.Author: teambloopy
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here at the end of March. We got a pretty cheap last minute online rate especially given the Berlin 1/2 marathon was on the same weekend. The hotel has everything you need it to and it is walkable to all the big Berlin sites plus easy U and S bahn access for those things a bit further afield. The room was big enough for us although is looking a bit shabby around the edges (as is the whole hotel). It was also a bit noisy between rooms and in the corridor. Breakfast was a good variety of typical hotel buffet fare although very busy on a Sunday morning. The staff were courteous but not quite helpful if that makes sense. Nevertheless we got a map and an explanation of how to get around. There is no free wifi in the hotel which is a real minus but there were 2 computers available in the lobby for guest use in 15 minute bursts (if you were lucky enough to get access to one - they were often busy). Would probably stay again with a cheap rate. Expect that the hotel will have a refurb in the next little while which will improve things. With some soundproofing it could make this place excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean, comfortable and spacious. The complementary tea/coffee was not adequately replenished daily. Breakfast was fine, but i was not worth 17 euros, and breakfast service was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when you visit Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location for visiting Berlin or consert in O2 world. Cross the bridge towards the Tower and you have a lot of restaurants on the left side, by the river. Yep the breakfast is superb. Taxi from schoenefeld airport berlin to hotel 24 km and cost is 35-40 Euro

Reviews.Title: “Near to everything - and still no noise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with rooms that has space and very clean with good service. Fantastic breakfast buffet, in a nice open restaturant. Near to public transport , and to the toru busses and river tours. Easy acces from the airport with direct bus connection 500 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I heart Novotel Mitte”
Reviews.Author: drgirlfriend74
Reviews.Content: I cannot say one negative thing about this hotel. The room, the room. I loved that room. I could have lived there for a month. It wasn't just the dressing gown and slippers waiting for me (terry cloth). The bathroom was large, clean, with a radio fitted to either pipe in music or from the telly in the room. The bed was so comfotable and the linen was good quality. The pillows were amazing, fluffy yet durable. The furniture was good quality but not flash. And the room was quiet. No noise from the hallway, could not hear the neighbours and we were facing the front of the building overlooking a very busy road and we did not hear any traffic noise ( and both our hearing is spot on). Double glazed windows, large airy rooms. I could not have wished for better. The bar was really nice, with the enourmous Berlin beers. And the food! We ate supper our second night at the restraurant. I savoured every morsel. I chose the salmon, with potato and bacon and Kenyan beans. With a butter and garlic mousse. My husband chose the pork steak, baked potato with sour cream (biggest potato and sour cream dressing I have ever seen) and cabbage. The portions were large and by the time I finished eating, I could barely manage to get to my room. The cost was reasonable as well: with tip about 50 euro but was well worth it. I should mention that we also had four massive beers with that meal. In my last few trips, no meal has matched that of the hotel's. The staff in any part of the hotel were all the same: polite, helpful, friendly and uber professional. My German language skills are not great and they all spoke French and English to a standard that made me feel that my German was just embarrassing. Eric at the front desk was incredible. So nice and helpful. He made us feel that we were the only guests in the hotel. I even wrote to Novotel to say that he did a brilliant job. The location is great. It is in what was once East Berlin. The hotel is central and only a few stops from the Alexanderplatz. The area is nice, clean and we felt completely safe going out at night. This is always a concern of mine as for years I travelled solo and will always scope the area. If I ever visit Berlin again, I am staying here. We managed to get £100 off the price of the hotel as the rooms are not cheap. But if you can manage to get a deal, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: LynTUk
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Berlin in just over a year. We have stayed at this hotel each time and have never been disappointed. The rooms are spacious and immaculately clean and the service efficient and friendly. This time our room overlooked the main road but there was no noise problem. The view of the TV tower which dominates the skyline wasgreat. Location wise, this is brilliant, U bahn a few seconds away and a pleasant enough stroll to many main sights.The breakfast is fantastic, try to book a room with breakfast inclusive else it could work out quite pricey. Take advantage of free late checkout if you're leaving on a sunday! We love Berlin and will return again and would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: epancy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago and when now I went to Berlin, I decided to return in this hotel. It was definitely a perfect choice. The hotel is situated near the museums area. It is in a quite location (on one side there is a street, but I had both the times the room on the other side, so It was really very quite for me). The room was big and the bathroom too. The breakfast was simply wonderful. It had really a lot of choices and everything was very very good. I also had a very good capuccino in the hotel bar. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. I will definitely return here for my next stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve1982uk
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel, clean and modern throughout. Adequate rooms (though the beds are not that comfortable). Very helpful and polite staff (especially Dominick). Only a few minutes' walk to the museums and the Mitte shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for price”
Reviews.Author: julesr101
Reviews.Content: Hotel between Branderburger Gate and Alexanderplatz, which are two areas with things to do and see, so close enough to walk to both (5-10 mins to alexanderplatz and 15-20 mins to the gate). We prefer to walk about and get to know the area so ideal for us but if people prefer, it is located <2 minutes walk from underground station. public transport is reasonably priced and never had to wait more than 5 mins for a train. Hotel clean and staff helpful and friendly, free use of sauna and fitness centre although we didn't use it. no wi fi in rooms though, 2 computers in the lobby which were always busy. Excellent value for location. we went in Feb so prob quiet season and hence low rates for us. (if anyone is thinking of going in feb - wrap up, the wind is FREEZING!!)

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with poor beds”
Reviews.Author: Jodiehop Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very average. The staff were nice but the beds were poor. It was over expesnive for what it was

Reviews.Title: “good value!”
Reviews.Author: Columbusandme
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice hotel. Breakfast is great. Bicycles for rent. Nice restaurants nearby. Quiet and relaxing. Great gym and sun in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “UK business raveller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - superb breakfast, good dinner, splendid service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: misslfm4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a short break in November 2010. The hotel was a very reasonable price and in a very good location. It is right near a U-Bahn station; although you can walk to Alexanderplatz in about 10-15mins. The staff were very friendly & helpful. We arrived about 11am, but were unsure as to whether or not we would be able to check in. We got to the desk and they checked us in straight away. Our room was overlooking a busy road, but this was not an issue for us. We ate in the restaurant one evening, the food we ate was really nice. The only negative I would say is that the computers which are situated in the lobby tend to get really busy. I noticed on a number of occasions that there were some people hogging them. They are free to use and very useful, they could probably do with getting a few more though. Overall a pleasant stay, and somewhere we would choose to stay again if we went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the foam beds!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGuru00
Reviews.Content: We have travelled the world with Novotel, but never have been obliged to sleep on a FOAM mattress with a plastic (waterproof) sheet on top! We had very little sleep because we sweated all night, probably in the sweat of previous occupants. When we complained the hotel said they could do nothing about this as all the beds had foam mattresses. What a pity Novotel spoil an otherwise good hotel with an outrageously bottom standard of bed. It is now difficult to trust the brand in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: We always try to choose a novotel for our trips. This one was very good. The rooms are just like any other novotel, very comfortable, good bathroom, good restaurant and excellent breakfast!!! Very near all museums, the dom, and walking distance from check-point charlie. It's a little bit distant from the main train station and it's better to take a taxi (around 10 euros) than changing S-bahns. The area doesn't have shops etc nearby so at night we preferred to eat at the hotel restaurant, which is nice , good price, but it's kind of repetitive... If it were not so cold we could go easily walking to Nicholai virtell, which is 500 m away and has a lot of restaurants, Maredo is great! Internet is free when using the computers of the lobby which is something that I really dislike about novotel. It's kind of mean such a good hotel charge us 2,50 euros for 15 min if we want wifi/cable internet in the room. I hope this changes and novotel starts doing just like Best western hotels in which wifi internet is free of charge in the rooms. The other thing I which is quite mean is not to refill soap bars in the bathrooms. I stayed for 5 nights and the cleaning lady never refilled the soap bars... This is something about novotel policy because the same thing happened in novotel Munich. I had to leave a note for her asking for soap bars, and she/he left only one (!) instead of replacing both.... Nevertheless, is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Berlin Mitte.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Splitmarkt(??) station and thus very convenient. The room is spacious and clean although a bit dated. There are 2 iMac in the lobby that you can use. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Great Staff, Can't Fault a Thing!”
Reviews.Author: trev1uk
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? From the very moment we arrived, we were greeted by warm and friendly staff....check-in was fast and effortless and we were soon in our room. We had arrived 3 hours before check-in but that was no problem - a room was free and we could use it straight away. That was great because we'd been travelling for 6 hours since 3am. Some hotels are a bit fussy about check-in times so this was a bonus. The room was spotless. Complimentary tea, coffee and mini-bar (the latter a booking deal you have to look out for, but it's there). Comfortable beds, good sound-proofing, controllable heating and a good, deep bath and shower. There's a small fitness centre:- gym and sauna both free of charge. There is a solarium as well but I dodn't use that so can't say if this is a chargeable extra. If you fancy a swim, there's a decent public swimming pool right opposite the hotel entrance. The dinner menu is excellent, if a little pricey, but we treated ourselves and it was delicious. Breakfast provided a choice of waffles, fruit, yoghurts, hot food, sliced cheese and meats etc. There are 2 computers in the Lobby, free to use, and a games console - again free. The hotel has a modern design and easy feel - the staff go out of their way to help and nothing was too much trouble. You're well-located for most of Berlin's sights here. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk to the Brandenburg Gate to the west, and 10 minutes to Alexanderplatz to the east. You could get a train from Schonefeld to Alexanderplatz. I've chosen this option before when travelling alone:- it's cheap and reliable, but this time we took a cab - a 30 minute journey and about 35 Euro. We took a cab both ways - the return journey at 4am, yet the price was the same. This was a short Xmas break for us as a family and this hotel was definately the right choice. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are fabulous and they are the greatest assets which will make one return to the hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: chinnySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Berlin Mitte Novotel from 19-22 Dec 2010. My 3-year old son was having a very bad cough due to the cold weather. I approached one of the hotel frontdesk staff, Ms Anne Peters, for direction to the nearest clinic. To our pleasant surprise, Ms Peters not only called the clinic to make advance booking for my son to see the doctor, she also offered to accompany us so that she can be the translator as the doctor could not speak English. Ms Peters went with us to the clinic, translated for us and waited till everything was fine. We are very grateful for Ms Peters' kind assistance. To get sick in a strange land was bad enough. If we were not able to communicate to the doctor to get treatment in time, things may be worse. Fortunately, Ms Peters was a great help and it definitely made life so much easier for us. We thought this was an exemplification of the hotel's great service standard. Their staff demonstrated a high level of service that sometimes go beyond the call of duties. We had a wonderful stay and the warmth and friendliness of the staff will definitely made us want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Crisser Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Novotel Berlin Mitte for our first stay in Berlin. The hotel was located within walking distance to Alexander Platz and Under den Linden. Nice clean rooms, very friendly and helpful service in the reception and excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel + Location”
Reviews.Author: joviscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in November. Good location. Only a 10/15 walk up the road to Checkpoint Charlie + the Berlin Wall. (Out the hotel, turn left, walk to Friedrich str., and turn left. Keep walking and you will see CC, then turn right + keep walking, you will come to the Berlin Wall). You can also come out the hotel, turn right, walk under the bridge and you will reach the shopping centre etc. Nice Irish pub 5 minute walk from the hotel (out and cross the road, 5 minute walk). We didnt have breakfast at the hotel. There were two computers in the lobby (beside the window). Residents get 20 minutes free. You just put your name in, tick a few boxes and on you go. Rooms were clean, cozy + quiet. Ours was round the back. I did have to turn the heating off at night - too noisy for me + the room was cozy enough anyway. There was a subway station just 5 minutes walk from the hotel - Spittelmarkt - it was very handy to a lot of places in Berlin, but a lot of it is walk-able. If + when we go back to Berlin, we will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ponaire
Reviews.Content: Overall we had an excellent stay in this hotel and I am probably not adding much to other reviews. As others have commented it is in an excellent location. Although on a fairly busy road, the area is in general quiet so good for sleeping. As others have commented, it is only a 2-3 minute walk from Spittlemarkt (U2 line) u-bahn station. Also as another reviewer said, it is easiest to get to the hotel if you exit at Leipziger Strasse exit, not Fisherinsel exit. Go out onto Leipziger Stasser, turn right and you will see the novotel sign right ahead of you. In addition to the u-bahn, it is possible to walk across the road from the hotel to the lovely Nikolaiviertel and on to Alexanderplatz. We ate one evening at the georgbraeue Brauhaus along the river in the Nikolaiviertel and there are a couple of other restaurants in this area. We had an excellent offer including breakfast. Our rooms were good. Spacious and although functional, very well-designed with a sofa and coffeetable. The bathroom was a fairly good size with bath and shower although it wasn't the most user-friendly in terms of changing between the two. Similarly a button on the hair dryer had to be continuously held for it to work which wasn't the most convenient. It was good to have tea and coffee but we found that the creamer sachets weren't always replaced and for some reason only one drinking chocolate sachet was ever given. Staff at Reception did arrange replacement supplies for us when asked. Breakfast was excellent although did not really vary at all during our 4 mornings there. There was a great selection of fruits, yoghurts as well as bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, meats, cheese, waffles (cook your own! they were delicious), breads, 3 different types of honey, lots of jams/preserves etc etc. The free apple mac computers in the lobby are a useful touch but were often being used during our stay although we were able to access them when needed. Although we had read that taxis could be very expensive to Schoenfeld airport. we decided to ask the hotel to order us one for our return flight due to the snow and having a morning flight and it cost just under 34 euros although the traffic was light. For 4 adults, we found it great value to get the daily small group ticket at the u-bahn station which allowed up to 5 adults all day usage on the u- and s-bahn for 15 euro 90. Remember to validate your ticket! Staff were lovely and very helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good locatiion.”
Reviews.Author: Mrsgetaway
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on a sightseeing weekend and were were delighted with the hotel. We were within walking distance of lots of the main tourist attractions. I can't understand previous reviews which state there are no restaurants or cafes near the hotel. About 5 minutes walk from the hotel on the way to Alexanderplatz there are loads of restaurants and bars down beside the river. We were delighted with the location. You have to go a bit further afield if you want nightclubs or trendy bars but if you are there for sightseeing it is fine. Spttlemarkt underground is just a few minutes walk from the hotel and the system is cheap and easy to use. It also only costs 2 Euros 50 to get to Schonefeld airport from the hotel by train and underground.The room was large and roomy and spotlessly clean and the staff were polite and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 minutes from U-Bahn, clean, tidy and one of the best breakfast buffets”
Reviews.Author: mrkgr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in what is used to be East Berlin. It is 3 minutes walk from Spittelmarkt station (U2 Line). The hotel is in a convinient location and within walking distance from Alexanderplatz and Berliner Dom. Unter Der Linden is about 10 minutes walk. It is clean and tidy, with very helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was one of the best for me. I did not like the fact that they charged for the Internet in the rooms, but you had the option to use one of the two Macs opposite the reception. Good choice for 4* hotel!

Reviews.Title: “4 days accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Efimov Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was quite comportable but not enough roomy for a family with a teenager. Breakfast was perfect! Unfortunately there are no cafes etc. in around of the hotel with the exception of the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfy base for exploring Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: chrismacd
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in this hotel with 2 friends. Very good location, 2 mins from nearest tube (Spittelmarkt). Great online rates.

Reviews.Title: “quality matches the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There are long latency at the restaurant in the morning and too little space in the restaurant for breakfast. The price of the Parking Facilities is too high The staff is smiling, welcoming and friendly

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for exploring the city on foot and by U bahn”
Reviews.Author: Travelledabit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by business colleagues and it met 4* expectations. It is two minutes from U bahn stop Stadtmitte (not Spittalmarkt as one traveller has advised!) and therefore easy to access the whole city from. The foyer is spacious and never felt busy, four elevators meant no waiting for uplift. The room was welcoming, warm and spotless. Design and furnishings are contemporary and dark wood floor (no carpet) worked well. Welcome packet of Haribos was random and cute! The beds were very comfortable but for me, the room was too warm for sleeping at night even with heating on lowest setting. Coffee and tea making facilities were provided - good selection of herbal teas. The breakfast buffet was really good with a tremendous variety of continental/ cooked foods/fruit and yoghurts available and plentiful breads, rolls, cakes etc There was a short order eggs and waffles cook who was kept busy and even at 10am end, there were staff stocking up on low items. There was no sense of rushing us late breakfasters out or clearing up around us. Staff were unfailingly polite and helpful in answering questions. The location is absolutely perfect for shopping (window) on the very chic Friedrichstrasse and within walking distance of Unter den Linden and The Brandenburg Gate. Nearby is a lovely square called Gendarmenplatz, on the corner of which is the most fabulous chocolate shop/restaurant! Highly recommended. The hotel is also extremely well placed to explore the old divide between east and west at Checkpoint Charlie and its museum - only 5 minutes walk. Fascinating history and testimony to the unbelievable bravery and inventiveness of the people who made it over the Wall. A perfect hotel for exploring the city on foot and by U bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we thought it would be.”
Reviews.Author: spennynash
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for a birthday treat for my partner. I knew he would love to visit the Berghain club and shop till he dropped in Space Hall and Hard Wax record shops. The novotel was advertised as being surrounded by shops and boutiques, having soundproofed rooms and being gay-friendly. I had originally felt that this 4 star hotel sounded young in its attitude, a great base for people with an outgoing attitude. This hotel is a 4 star family hotel, not at all friendly to people who have come to Berlin to party. The staff were stiff and formal, seemingly shocked when we asked if we could have a bottle of wine at 5am.(They refused) There was no need for soundproofing as the clientele seemed to creep around and speak only in hushed tones. There was no PAY TV, although it was advertised in their literature. Everything closed at 12.30, bar, room service and minds. Also...'Surrounded by shops' actually means 'shops are 10 minutes down the road' for this establishment. Book this hotel if you have a family and want a top class and safe environment. Do not book, if you want a hardcore weekend dedicated to dancing, drinking and general mayhem.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ozgals
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in this hotel in August 2010 and was very impressed. My room was a generous size, with king size bed, plasma TV and a good sized bathroom. The room looked over Leipziger Strasse and whilst it is a busy road, unless you want to open the windows, it is very well sound-proofed and I didn't hear any traffic noise at all. The staff were very helpful. The food in the restaurant was very nice and the wait staff were helpful. There is a buffet breakfast available, which had good choices. If you want WiFi internet access in your room you can pay for this when you check in. There is free Wi-Fi in the reception area, with 2 computers, however these were often being used by other guests. The location is excellent - a very short walk to/from Spittelmarkt U-Bahn and walking distance to the Spree and Alexanderplatz. I will definitely be staying at this hotel on my next visit to Berlin. Tip - if you are arriving on U-Bahn, get off at Spittelmarkt and take Leipziger Strasse exit (not Fischerinsel exit). The hotel entrance is actually in Leipziger Strasse (up a service road).

Reviews.Title: “Just as I read in Tripadvisor !”
Reviews.Author: daveHWicklow
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the Eastern Sector. Yes, many critics complained about the price of breakfast but it was fabulous, no need for any other big meals later in the day. Most tourist attractions within walking distance. I find Tripadvisor very reliable and accurate in describing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault them, front desk staff were all very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: GibbsLondon
Reviews.Content: My first and lasting impression of this hotel was how helpful and accommodating the reception desk staff were. My friend and I only spoke english however the german speaking staff who only spoke basic english made every effort to understand our requests and even allowed us to have a later checkout time without any extra cost as a good will gesture. Didn't use much of the facilties at the hotel as we were out quite alot but the room and bathroom were both very clean and had everything we needed for our weekend trip. Great location if you want to explore the night life in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Responsive Service”
Reviews.Author: caseymel
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the summer heatwave. We found our room extremely hot and requested a room change. The front desk responded that they would work to solve our problem. A few hours later they informed us that we would be transferred to another room. We found our new room comfortable and much cooler. We also ate at the hotel restaurant and found the service and food very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Khalid_Nadeem
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights 21st & 22nd July 2010. Our stay was pleasant like any Novotel Hotel. Breakfast was usual Novotel breakfast and that is one of the reason we prefer Novotel wherever we find. The best way to reach hotel is Taxi it will be difficult to reach to hotel with luggage by metro or underground on very first day. But there is a bus if I remember correctly # 47 that drops you in front of a building behind which you will find hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel... what you would expect from a chain hotel like Novotel”
Reviews.Author: KKE87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The front desk spoke decent English but did not offer any advice about sightseeing, getting around or any nearby supermarkets or restaurants. The room was decent size and quite comfortable. Tea and coffee in the room as well as a mini bar. Didn't use the in room internet as we heard it was very expensive. The location is quite good and we walked most places... about 2km or 30min walk to brandenburg gate and about 1km to Alexanderplatz... the U-Bahn is only 5 min away which is convenient. Overall I wouldn';t pay the full room rate here, but if you get a good price it is quite comfortable and exactly what you would expect from a Novotel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for exploring Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeJNeath
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, clean and friendly and so close to all attractions that Berlin has to offer. Rooms are spotless and staff are very friendly. Turn left (not right) out of hotel, then just across the river is the underground system which gets you everywhere quickly - fantastic system, easy to use. Would stay here again, no problem and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent amenities and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travellers067
Reviews.Content: This is a good four star hotel close to the Markisches Museum U Bahn station and about a fifteen minute walk to the Checkpoint Charlie end of Friedrichstrasse. We were a little annoyed to find ourselves in a smoking room when we had requested non-smoking but were moved the next day. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with some unexpected touches like having a TV speaker in the bathroom and an area on the bathroom mirror which did not get steamed up, making it much easier to shave than usual. We appreciated the free 20 minute use of the internet in the foyer. The hotel is large so the service is not personal but the staff we encountered were all helpful and polite. There is a bar which serves snacks and a restaurant. Breakfast was an expensive 17 euros but was good quality. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights from June 28, 2010 to July 5, 2010 and found this property to be an excellent place to stay in Berlin. It is very clean and well maintained. It is reasonably priced and provides excellent value. The employees of the hotel were very professional and courteous. The location is close to many sights including the Berliner Dom, Museum Island. I used the U-Bahn station Spittlemarkt when travelling beyond the centre of the city. However, I was able to access the major sights by foot from the hotel. Although it is located on a busy street and I was on the 2nd floor, I did not hear any traffic. I slept well in this hotel. My room was large and the bed was very comfortable. It was clean and immaculate. I found the breakfast buffet included in my rate to be very generous and diverse. There were items such as fruit, cheese, yogurt, pastries, bread, sausages, bacon and eggs etc. There was a selection to meet all dietary tastes. I enjoyed having a snack and a drink after a day of sightseeing in the bar and yes watched a couple of world cup games! The waiters and waitresses were very welcoming and made my stay a very pleasant one. When I return to Berlin I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend this hotel to others for their stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bliss_gr
Reviews.Content: Novotel offers the amenities of a big hotel, it is really comfortable and clean and it is extremely good value for money, considering the services and the fact that it is centrally situated. It will be perfect if you are a couple or travelling for business. It might not be the best choice if you seek for something more funky, stylish, something more suitable for 20-25-year-old people. So, the only 'disadvantage' of this hotel is, I would say, that it is more suitable for 30 something travellers, families, couples and business people. It will be conservative and impersonal for younger people who want more fun. Other than that, a perfectly good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Robalmar
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is was good - close to most attractions - as Berlin is spread out, we hired bikes for two days and this made it easy to access all attractions. The hotel reception is bland - the staff were not very welcoming or attentive. The rooms are very small in comparison to other Novotels i have stayed and very stark - our room was painted all white! - Internet access in rooms very expensive. The bed and pillows very uncomfortable... I must say - not the best place we stayed on our travels thru Europe this year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and very affordable plus the bonus of being in a great location with easy access to all of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ddale
Reviews.Content: A very clean, comfortable and modern hotel, which is extremely well located for all the sights and attractions of Berlin. The public transport system in Berlin is excellent and the hotal is 10-15mins walk from the U-Bahn (Markisches Museum or Spittelmarkt) with bus stops also close by (5mins). Museumsinsel (Museum Island) is only 20 mins or so walk away as is the Nikolaiviertel area, which has a number of traditional German bars/restraurants - in fact we walked there each evening for a bite to eat. The staff were very friendly and helpful making this an excellent place to be based for a few days in Berlin. We will definitely stay there again! (PS. Excellent rates for familes with children under 16). Berlin is also a very friendly and safe city for walking around!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and great personnel”
Reviews.Author: TheDreamGod
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a few days in February, The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Extremely clean.The higher floors have a nice view. The personnel is extremely polite. We tried their room service and we got a very tasty & huuuge breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “ACTUALLY CANCELLED”
Reviews.Author: istanbulmythos
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Berlin after Hannover fair in April, but actually the closing down of air traffic by volcanic ash we could not go anywhere, but only Athens. As we did the payment online I would like to thank deeply to Anja Leisegang / Rooms Division Manager of Novotel Berlin Mitte for understanding this natural disaster / extraordinary situation and sent us the money back to our credit card. And with the same situation I would like to mention you NEVER prefer Crowne Plaza Hannover, because they are inconsiderate/ insensitive that much that they can mention "the risk of the closing down of air traffic is not the risk of the hotel" Someday I will go to Berlin Mitte Novotel that is for sure....Thank you Anja!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant room and excellent retaurant; walk to Museum Island”
Reviews.Author: manyamiletogo
Reviews.Content: We found the restaurant especially convenient for lunch and supper, as there are none other nearby; it also serves very good food and refined atmosphere. The room was lovely. For its price category, this hotel s better than most. We decided to eat breakfast at a nearby at a small cafe, as the the hotel's spread was too expensive for anyone who wants just a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: duckegguk
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin In Feb for a weekend so wanted to stay central to save time and this hotels location is excellent. Few minutes walk to the nearest underground or UBahn as the Berliners know it! Very quick and effiecent system you're minutes from the main areas of interest. The hotel itself is light and airy, friendly attentive front desk and bar service. We had breakfast there one morning which was very nice, though didn't do it twice because we were on a budget and it cost 17 Euros each. Front desk staff were also very helpful with directions etc. Room was good, very clean and functional better quality than alot of hotels and very quiet. This hotel is very good at what it does but don't expect anything extravagant, it's just very clean and functional. It has got a higher price tag but thats due to the location. Personally I found it very comfortable and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I usually choose Novotel because of their buffet breakfast which is often included in the room rate: good quality and variety..no need to have lunch after such a big breakfast (from croissant to smoked salmon). Very clean, with great service and helpful receptionists. The rooms are very wide and have a big sofa. Good location: near the underground, bus lines and Alexanderplatz. The only bad point were the pillows on the bed (too soft).

Reviews.Title: “They deliver what they promise”
Reviews.Author: DahlFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Novotel Berlin Mitte in a standard room. The room size (approx. 30 m2) is qui-te good. There are no from the neighbors. We only heard the vacuum cleaner from the staff and the road outside (if you open the window). There is a double bed and an expandable sleeping sofa for 2 persons. The room can fit 4 persons for sleeping. The sofa is ok but not like a real bed. You need to ask for additional bed linned, pillows and so in order to fit 4 persons in the room. The bed is not Sofitel level but is above average. Not to hard and not to soft. Pillows were not my favorite but they rarely are. The hotel seems quite new. All room facili-ties are in good order. The bath room is a good reasonable size. Not fancy with marble but functional. The bathtub is a little smaller than normal size and not very "sexy". Good pressure on water and it can be very hot! There is a coffee facility in the room but in my opinion it is only for emergency! There is a Xbox (in a play area) next to the reception and two Apple with Internet explorer for free us-age! This is a good thing for kids! The breakfast is 17 Euros per person. We did not use it but went to the Balzar Coffee shop on Karl Liepknects strasse (100 meters from Radisson Blu hotel). Here you can have good coffee and sand-wiches. The parking facilities are excellent (not free). There is an underground garage (closed with gate at night) but you can enter 24h. The spaces are fairly large, good lightning and there is a short walk to the lift. We used the bar and there was a good selection and service. The prices are a little above normal level but ok for a hotel (Weissbier is about 4,90 euro). The hotel seemed completely full but everything just worked fine (we saw there was a line for the break-fast area one morning but that was it). We took the Top tour sight seeing tour (15 euros per person). The red bus was ok, but the every 15 min. departure did not. We waited at one point almost 45 minutes. The yellow busses (other company) pasted us 4 times. Go for the one with most departure – especially in high season. Go to the Italian restaurant La Rustica near the Hackescher market train station. Very good pizza and good service. We had 2 salads, 2 pizzas, drinks and coffee for 46 Euros. My only downside of the hotel is the pricing of Internet. Flat rate for 24 hours is 19,90 Euros. This is too expensive – but cheaper than other hotels. (Remember to bring a longer cable – the one in the room is only 1 meter). The speed is 2mb up and 2mb down. WIFI was not performing properly but I didn't investigate it further. I would use the hotel again – this is one of the more well-driven Novotels. As an Accor Platinum member I must say that there are no surprises and they deliver what they promise. It is placed in a good location to go see the attractions (Alexander Platz 10 minutes – Potsdamer Platz 25 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have a rock bottom deal”
Reviews.Author: KHK1
Reviews.Content: Overall: non inspiring - as you walk out of your room, you hope that at least the city can deliver something that won't compound the that rotten feeling in your stomach from the flight meal.
