Room: poor quality Fixtures and fittings: were cheap and tasteless - awful décor fro the 90s Food: Didn't go near the dining room but looked overpriced Coffee: eeeww, awful People: sightseers crashing through the corridors to get to a plastic breakfast from 07:30 to 09:00 Location: fine if you are going to the one area but then becomes tricky as your explore the wider city Service: very good I will not stay there again - better hotels in the East such as Michelbergerhotel. I'll be avoiding any Accor Hotels too

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pnina_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel in late February 2010 and enjoyed it very much. Great breakfast, comfortable room and very friendly staff. It's also in a good location and near the subway. I wished only that the receptionist knew better english. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: HallidayScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days (Fri-Mon) on a deal sourced via Expedia - £290 for 3 nights with breakfast included - and decided on this hotel based on reading reviews on here and on its position in the city (close to U2 and city centre). The hotel is 150m from the Spittelmarkt underground station (but not signposted when you come out of the station!) and is beside the Liepzigstrasse - a busy dual-carriageway. Rooms up to number 15 (115, 215 etc) face onto the road and so are very noisy if you have the windows open - however, with the very good windows closed we couldn't hear the traffic. If you like to sleep with the window open, ask for a high number room at the back of the hotel which faces blocks of flats. By the way, we spotted a particular neighbour in a tower block watching the hotel rooms through binoculars, so keep the net curtains shut if you value your privacy! We also found the rooms to be very warm, even when the Air-con was switched on and set to HIGH and COLD. Our friends had the same problem. It's in a great location - within 3 stops of Alexanderplatz and 10 mins walk to Checkpoint Charlie, the University and Potsdamer Platz. There's an Indian restaurant next door (empty) and a Chinese about 5 mins walk toward CC (which looks nice but was quite poor by our standards). The hotel is a modern boutique style, very nicely finished and with Apple Macs at reception for guests to use. The rooms are smart and very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast is buffet style with a great selection - but not worth the 15 Euros they want - make sure you get this included in your deal as there are no cafes nearby that you could go to! There is also a gym and sauna in the hotel but we never used these - there is a public swimming pool next to the hotel if you want a swim while you're there. Strange there is no mention of this in the hotels info anywhere. The bar is also HUGELY expensive - nearly £10 for a cocktail which we got elsewhere for £5. We opted to buy at Lidl, just 200m along the road and stock our HUGELY EXPENSIVE mini-bar in the room with our own drink - your 5 euro bottle of Holsten Pilsner in the mini-bar is 49 cents at Lidl!!!!!! PROS - great location but pricey. Staff and cleanliness of hotel and rooms very good. CONS - Very pricey bar and mini-bar and a pricey breakfast which was not worth the 15 Euros (unless included in your package). Noisy rooms if windows to be left open. Lifts (3) only take 6 people or 4 plus cases - very small. No ice machines anywhere but shoe cleaners at lifts on each floor. Rooms very warm and stuffy at night - air-con appeared to make no difference to this.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: ICE-Zugfahrer
Reviews.Content: All there, with a good location just next to the Nikolai Viertel area. Managed to get dinner even when I arrived at about 2130, not always possible at Novotels in my experience. Room in very good condition. Only downside, I couldn't get the Wifi to work in the room, only in the corridor, which was a bit of a pain, so had to do my office work with my computer balanced on a knee next to the lift!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: diminlondon
Reviews.Content: Such a good location and value for the money that you cant go worn. Postdammer platz is in few min walking distance and hotel has got evrything you need, very clean, good size of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: dwarfie
Reviews.Content: The stafff could not be more helpful. The service was excellent. The buffet breakfast was extensive serving every taste. The evening menu was surperb. Room clean & comfortable. Easy access to underground station which is very easy to use, tickets/maps available from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: briwire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid-January. Were delayed on our outward journey by airline problems which meant that we arrived at 2am. My daughter e-mailed them to inform them that it would be a late arrival and they responded with a friendly re-assuring reply. The hotel and rooms were very clean, comfortable and tidy. Breakfast was very good-buffet style with sausages, scrambled eggs, various cereals, fruit, bread cheese and my favourite, a DIY waffle maker (don't forget to press the start button). Only things missing from the menu for me were mushrooms and hash browns, but it set us up for the day. There wasn't a great deal around the hotel other than residential blocks, but the area seemed safe. The nearest U-bahn was Spittlemarkt, about 5 minutes walk. From there it was easy access to all over berlin, 3 stops to Alexanderplatz. Beforehand I e-mailed asking for a high quiet room and was given just that on the side away from the main road, but to be honest i don't think you would get mush noise even on that side. Got it for 96 Euros a night. Was able to leave our bags in a secure room on our departure day, and saw something advertised about being able to stay in the room until 5pm on a Sunday. Check first though. Didn't get a chance to try the sauna or gym.

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: paulaDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent, would recommend to anyone, singles, couples or families. Great location, many things within walking distance but what isn't is easily accessible by tube. We took our trip to combine Christmas markets and historical locations and we were very surprised as to how close everything was. Highly recommended. Rooms were great (we travelled with 2 teenagers) and we were expecting cramped conditions but we were pleased with the space. Having said that the children spent a great deal of their spare time on the apple macs and x box available in the foyer for them. Breakfast was excellent, we filled up on this and lasted until evening. We ate in the hotel at night too. The bar staff were brill nothing was too much trouble. We ate in there rather than the restaurant (same menu). We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation close to Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: paulbru
Reviews.Content: Novotel always provide a comfortable, nicely designed bedroom and bathroom. The staff are usually well trained and helpful. This is the case in Mitte, too. The positive aspect of the location is that Alexanderplatz is just 5 mins away. There are two U-bahn stations within less than 5 mins. The negative aspect of the location is that the hotel is on a busy four-lane "motorway" through the city. If you keep the windows closed you don't hear the traffic noise. But it's a tower block in a district of tower blocks (old east Berlin). The breakfast is fantastic. However, it's not cheap and it's a long walk to find an alternative. They overcharge for WIFI. In general, I was satisfied with the value for money mainly because the room is so comfortable. But note my remarks!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, although some rude staff”
Reviews.Author: saf_2m
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend on a road trip with the kids. We chose the Novotel since I am an A-Club member and because of their convenient children's policy. You can always bring two kids under the age of 16 and they eat and sleep for free. There's always a sofabed in the room. Nice and spacious rooms with flatscreen tv. Bathrooms a little on the smaller side. Toilet paper was not replaced by room serice even though it was obviously running out by the time we had house keeping. However nice level of cleanliness. Even the standard rooms get bathrobe and slippers which was a positive surprise keeping in mind that this is a 4-star hotel in Europe (most do not provide this). They even had a rain and massage shower. Value for money on that one. The hotel is in the Mitte area within walking distance to Alexanderplatz and Nicolai Viertel. There is a supermarket (Edeka) just around the corner. Only bad experience was at breakfast. Selection is very basic with not even a handful of hot items. However, we could have survived that if it was not for the extremely rude breakfast lady who pas present there that day. On Friday morning the 11th of December a lady with a pair of round glasses, thirty-something, a harsh non-smiling facial expression and a kind of ponytail was working there. She wanted to seat us in a very crowded area, however since we were there with a two-year old and a five year old, we requested for a more quiet seating area. We could see a couple of available tables a little bit away. At first she didn't understand (most of the staff speak only German), but then she eventually nodded. When my husband went over there to sit with our daughter she came running all of a sudden and literally poked his shoulder very hard in front of all the other guests while yelling something in German about the tables being a la carte. The worse part was the rolling of her eyes at us directly in our faces as we were imbeciles. We felt very embarrased and moved away to another table. However, the rest of the breakfast experience was shadowed by this rude "welcome". We lost our appetites and the next morning decided to skip breakfast down in the restaurant. We just spend two weeks travelling in Malaysia and Singapore last month where we also stayed at several international chains, including Novotel. In Asia this kind of behaviour from a staff member will be unheard of. Just to add, we were the only Muslim tourists there. My husband has a beard and I wear the head scarf. Although we would just hate to think that the above mentioned incident had anything to do with this fact. I'm sure that the management at the Novotel Mitte trains their staff in the highest level of service and politeness towards ALL guests. However, the management should also be aware of the fact that most hotel guests are in general very sensitive to bad behaviour from staff members. Just one bad incident can make a guest forget all the other nice things and never want to stay there again. That is not a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “A star in the middle of Berlin...”
Reviews.Author: funfamilyistanbul
Reviews.Content: Hotel relevance starts with booking, they have excellently tracked our requests, room preparation and when we arrived everything was perfectly set up. Room had full of functions, phone, LCD TV screen with 30+ channels, minibar, correct level of lighting, bathroom with shower and bathtub and inroom electronic safecase. Location was perfect for discovering Berlin. Only few minutes walking distance to Museum Island(Museuminsel) with 6 major German museums, especially Pergammon Museum. 15 minutes walk to AlexanderPlatz activities, Berliner Fehrnsturm(tower with rotating restaurant), SeaLife and so on. Only 2 minutes for accessing Berlin's U & S Bahn network via Spittelmarkt Ubahn station. Breakfast was perfect, wide range of selections available without any exceptions. Restaurants services were also great. Staff is incredible, they deserve to wait on the queue, they are really helpful and really help with experience. We had a great stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sehrazat93
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Novotel Berlin Mitte in late August. The hotel is situated in a quiet spot of Berlin, yet very close to both the metro station and the Alexanderplatz centre. The room was spacious, comfort and very clean (I am a bit picky about cleanliness). In addition it gets a lot of day light, the aircondition was in the right temperature and the room was very quiet.The double bed was also spacious and really comfortable. I have stayed in other 4-star hotels but this Novotel definitely was worth its cost. In addition, we did not book too early, yet we found an offer (including breakfast) which was very good (although immediately payable). In a nutshell, Novotel Berlin Mitte was one of my best hotel experiences and definitely a place to stay if ever in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, family focused hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: OurGrandDayOut
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here with two young children. It is a typical Novotel, with a sofa bed for the kids (we pull out the mattress and make the sofa up as well, because our kids don't sleep well in the same bed). Not a lot of room when the beds are set up, but we didn't spend a lot of time there. Staff were very helpful, and mostly friendly also. We parked one night in the hotel, but then parked for free in the bus lane over the weekend. Breakfast was incredible, with everything you could possibly want - but super busy, so difficult sometimes to get in and then out again. The playstation was well used, and a great place for the kids to meet each other. The one internet station was busy, and there was, unfortunately, no free Wifi available. What we liked the most about this hotel, was the location - a very easy walk to Spitlemarkt U-bahn in one direction, or a short 10 minute walk to Alexanderplatz in the other. We took a fantastic Fat Tire Bike Tour which we all enjoyed, complete with tag-along bike for our 5 year old. I would HIGHLY recommend anyone taking this tour, and preferably early on in your stay. It was entertaining, fascinating, and also helped give us our bearings in such a large city.

Reviews.Title: “German hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoSinaia
Reviews.Content: Expensive but good!Good service&good breakfast.Expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “The 4 stars bargain”
Reviews.Author: Austriacus
Reviews.Content: During a three days visit to Berlin I benefited from the so-called ‘city breaks’ rate of Novotel Berlin Mitte. If one is willing to stay for at least two days and to pay the entire price at booking with no option of rescheduling or cancellation it permits enjoying the comfort of a very good 4 stars hotel while paying less than in many of Berlin's 3 stars hotels. This bargain price may have had something to do with the fact that I was there at the beginning of August which probably is not the high season for the hotels of Berlin. My motivation for choosing this hotel was the air-conditioning of the room which worked very well at these summery temperatures and fortunately is not switched off upon leaving the room. The only minor drawback of Novotel Berlin Mitte is its vicinity. It is neither ugly nor frightening, but does not offer many restaurants and shops within a ten minutes walking distance. Although generally this Fischerinsel area is very calm the hotel is situated directly at the artery of Gertraudenstrasse, where traffic starts to become heavy already at 5 o'clock in the morning. Then one would appreciate even better sound-proof properties of the windows, though they are not bad in this respect. Apart from that the picture is 100 percent rosy. The decoration of the rooms is that of a typical design-orientated hotel: elegant, bright and comfortable, although I would have preferred a less stylish look if there had been more cupboard space in return. Enormous attention is directed at details which are intended to make the guests feel well. For instance, half a dozen (!) different body care products are provided, further pillows of different softness as well as extra blankets are available in the cupboard and a shoe shining machine in the corridor can be used for free, to name just a few. The additional blanket may be advantageous because originally there is only a single blanket for a double bed, which will not be appreciated by all those sharing the room. My room was in a top condition, perfectly clean, equipped with an excellent bed and a fairly large flat screen TV. The buffet breakfast included in the ‘city breaks’ rate is marvellous. I do not think that somebody could miss anything there. Thus, if you succeed to get the more than 40 percent reduction on the regular room rate due to the ‘city breaks’ option of Novotel Berlin Mitte you will definitely be happy about the good bargain of enjoying its very high level of service for such a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: javp
Reviews.Content: I admitt that I am a fan of the Novotel chain. Travelling with my spouse and two kids, 8 and 12, namely through Europe, Novotel hotels are very confortable and do welcome families with young children, and the kids just love it. That said, the Novotel Berlin Mitte is a good choice if you want to visit Berlin. It is near several means of transport, within a walking distance of some of the most iconic monuments and parts of the city and has a nice restaurant zone, with lots of choices, 500 m from the hotel. The service and the accomodations are the usual you can find in almost all Novotel units. Not luxury, but confortable with professional and well trained staff that is always there to help you. Also as usual, a very good breakfast. If you want to to go to Berlin, get one of their "hot deals" and stay at the Novotel Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good central location”
Reviews.Author: redsox2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from travelling eastern Europe. This was out first hotel in a 15 day trip we took and stayed here for 3 nights. We found this hotel very comfortable with overall friendly staff and was in a good location close to the train. We would recommend this hotel based on the budget and location in Berlin. Breakfast was pricey so we ate at a good little bakery type shop around the right corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BerlinerPooh
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 2 nights during one of the hottest weeks we've experienced in Berlin. The room we had was located on the west side of the hotel; spacious, clean, comfortable and very quiet. Air-conditioning worked efficiently and silently, allowing us a good night's rest. The shower broke down on our first morning but after reporting it to the reception, it was repaired and in working order by the time we got back in the afternoon. One little annoyance (to me anyway) was the loudspeaker in the bathroom which forced me to listen to whatever my husband was watching on TV. No worries, we just disconnected it and I could enjoy a relaxing bath undisturbed :o) Breakfast was of excellent quality and worth savouring! The members of staff we encountered were always courteous and the hotel had a serene business-like atmosphere which we appreciated. For a small fee we were able to park our rental car in the underground parking area which is very secure and has direct access to the hotel lobby. The location of the hotel is a bonus; shops, restaurants, underground station and tourist sights within walking distance. We will probably stay here again on our next visit to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ondrasek
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay in Berlin. Hotel was ok, very friendly staff everywhere, the rooms nice and bright. We had to fit in a baby bed without any problems. Also, the windows were so good we couldn´t hear any noise from the street. Breakfast was superb, I recommend to everybody. The location is ok, close to U-Bahn and Alexanderplatz and many restaurants in Hackescher markt. I can only recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great time”
Reviews.Author: Peetzer
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay in the weekend and stayed in a standard room for two. The room is spatious and very clean. I read reviews about the bed but had no complaints, it is sturdy but comfortable and you have plenty of pillows. I don't know if it is just me but the room was very hot, I set the airco to cold, opened the window but still hot. Bath was pretty standard (plastic) and combined with shower. However the showerhead could be set to massage and such which is favourable after a long walk in Berlin. Towels just sufficed but no problem. The hotel is very close to the U-Bahn (Spittlemarkt) and just two stops to centre. Also close to the Nicolaiviertel where you can dine for instance at Mutter Hoppe which I recommend. Breakfast is 17 Euro but is good and you have plenty to pick from. The room has also a safe but the batteries were empty and even after I asked were not replaced the next day, so I had to put my valueables in the main safe. Coffee and such were replaced after use. Staff is friendly, only girl (who appearently just started) annoyed me a bit a checkout. Also good to know is that a supermarkt is on the other side of the Novotel, so very convenient. It is typical Novotel quality and if you need to stay for a reasonable price I suggest going there.

Reviews.Title: “Great choise!”
Reviews.Author: GreeceMaria
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. The second bed was realy big for the third person. There was only one combuter to access the internet. Breakfast was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easter trip”
Reviews.Author: fisti
Reviews.Content: Novotel in Berlin Mitte was a perfect location, within easy walking distance from the U-Bahn and Museum Island. We stay five nights and we walked to Museum Island, to Reichstag, to Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, and we move easly outside the Mitte area using bus and U-bahn The hotel location is close to a pedestrian shopping area with lots of great restaurants (10 min walk). The room itself was nice, clean, modern and quiet. The room had a minibar and had plenty of space to keep suitcases, bags, etc... The breakfast was excellent I recommend the Novotel Mitte to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: 2009travelswithkids
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night in Berlin, we felt like we got to see a lot and that was mostly due to the excellent location of the Novotel. As another reviewer stated, it is great for families with children as well. There are not a lot of hotels in Europe that allow 4 people per room, even though they are only ages 3 and 1. I called other places and they wanted me to book 2 rooms. The Novotel allowed us to only have 1 room. There was a nice kids area in the lobby with books, blocks, and a Playstation 2 (I only saw soccer (football) for a game, but I don't know if there were more). The location was within easy walking distance of the U-Bahn and Museum Island. We walked to Museum Island, caught a city bus to Reichstag, walked to Brandenburg Gate, Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe, Checkpoint Charlie, and back to the Novotel. That was all with a 3 year and a 1 year old who both were not feeling very well. The room itself was nice, clean, and modern. It was a little crowded because we had the pull out couch pulled out for an extra bed. The room had a minibar, which we used to keep drinks in. It had plenty of space to keep suitcases, bags, etc... I was very impressed with everything about our visit. I recommend the Novotel Mitte to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good location & kind support”
Reviews.Author: daniel8336
Reviews.Content: Novotel hotel is comfortable for our family. our chilren had happy and enjoy at Novotel

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: davideadvisor
Reviews.Content: Nice and easy! Gorgeous breakfast, smiling personnel, fully equipped room, excellent price. kids were satisfied with Playstation

Reviews.Title: “Quality Centrally Located Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HawksMan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel in Feb 09. The hotel was very easy to find with signage pointing you in the correct location once you get out of the U-Bahn. Everything in this hotel was what I have come to expect from the Novotel brand. Efficient, comfortable, modern and polished. Staff were OK - helpful without being outgoing. Had no problems with them at all, but I thought they could be a little more friendly. Munich Novotel staff really set a high standard! Location - this is difficult. The location for walking to all the attractions in Berlin is tops. There is a U-Bahn very close if required. The immediate area around the hotel is bland - which is not always a bad things if you are there on business. Overall, I would go back here for the central location (to both East and West Berlin sights) and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: pige_paa_ferie
Reviews.Content: Was staying here for a week as I was in Berlin for a seminar and spent the weekend looking around. The location is good for people who cannot afford 5 star hotels in the centre. This hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from the train station. Right next to it is a swimming hall. It was close to Alexandreplatz where the tv tower is. Not far from there the west side is within walking distance. The room was spacious, modern and very clean. Bath tub was a big plus. The hotel staff mostly left me to my own but were friendly when I needed a cab, room service or information. The breakfast buffet is really nice. Dinner food is great but can be a bit more expensive than eating out in a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: FCUNCTATOR
Reviews.Content: As it happens I stayed at the Novotel Charenton (technically outside Paris, but accessible with a regular Metro ticket) on Monday 9 February , and in Novotel Berlin Mitte on Friday-Saturday 13-14 February 2009 – inviting comparisons (the more so as I am familiar with Novotel St Pancras, Novotel Tower Hill and Novotel Greenwich in London). As any frequent traveller knows, value for money is poor in these hotels if you pay the appropriately-named “rack-rate” plus the high charge for breakfast. But there are “offers” all year round, and if one is lucky enough to know the dates in advance, many bargains can be had by “shopping around” among the various Accor, Hilton or Holiday Inn offers (to name but the best-known chains – Novotel belongs with Accor). My verdict: Novotel Berlin Mitte has a competitive advantage over Novotel Charenton in that you get a centrally-located hotel (by the way the best U-Bahn station is Spittelmarkt, not Märkisches Museum – the Accor people could not care less about customers without cars, and their location maps and directions are generally useless for pedestrians) at the cost (I paid 85 euros per night incl. breakfast) of a “suburban” hotel like Novotel Charenton. I remember Tripadvisor reporters complaining about the fact that the WC was separate from the bathroom – the general rule in Novotels. But it is IN the bathroom of the Novotel Berlin Mitte. A bathroom with a combination bath/shower. In the Novotel Charenton, I only had a shower (poor value for what claims to be a four-star hotel). In London, Novotels have both a bath AND a shower. So you never know what to expect when you book – irritatingly for hotels with the same name. Likewise, some London Novotels have a shaving mirror. Novotel Charenton does not have any, but Novotel Berlin Mitte has them – a “luxury touch” at a rate far inferior to London ones. On the other hand, it did not have the rotating desk typical of Novotels, and it had an old-fashioned TV, compared with the flat screen I got in the much cheaper Ibis Gentilly in Paris two weeks ago. Interesting international comparisons can be made between the Novotels I have so far patronised in London, Paris, Berlin and Hamburg. Only the London Novotels offer fried eggs – with the best bacon. For some reason the German and French cooks in the Novotels do not know the trick of frying bacon – theirs is far too dry and hard. The choice of meats (notably hot and cold sausage) is best in Novotel Berlin Mitte. The bread rolls are also excellent. If you prefer perfect toasted bread go to London. Novotel Charenton comes a poor third – probably reflecting the fact that the French do not attach much importance to their breakfast. Novotel Charenton would no doubt be best for dinner, on the other hand (though I have never had dinner in any Novotel). But the Novotel Berlin Mitte is not far from the Nicholas Quarter (Nicolaiviertel), where you will have a marvellous sauerkraut downed with a pint of excellent Berlin lager at for instance Zur Rippe restaurant at an unbeatable price. Give a wide berth to Zum Nussbaum, where you will be rudely turned off (even though in perfect English) if coming after 22:00 on a Saturday night. Conclusion : if what you want is a comfortable room with excellent breakfast and quick access to the city centre by public transport, the Novotel Berlin Mitte is for you. Unreservedly recommended – whatever the reason for your stay in Berlin – provided you can get a bargain package.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel just outside centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KevinANDShan
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night in Berlin, and had some trouble finding the hotel initially as we got down at the Markisches Museum U-Bahn station based on a previous review. However, we found out the following day that Spittelmarkt station was much nearer. Turn left from the hotel entrance and you go through a backlane and a bridge to get to the station. Spittelmarkt station is about 10-15mins ride away from the main areas, and I would suggest you buy the one day transport ticket at EUR6.10 or EUR6.50 if you are going to Schonofeld Airport on that day. All passes expire at 3am the next day from the day you validate it.. Now to the hotel, a very classic Novotel standard hotel that we have come to expect of. Very clean, modern and nice amenities. Our room did not come with breakfast so we cannot comment, but otherwise, it's really a great hotel if you want to be near town but do not want to be near to all the buzz. One bad thing is that there are not much shops or eateries around the hotel, so if you are hungry at night, you would have to either eat at the hotel cafe, or take a train to Alexanderplatz if it is a weekend to satisfy your hunger pang. Berlin is a wonderful city to explore, especially for the history and WWII buff. Checkpoint Charlie is a must, and do have at least two hours to explore the Museum at Checkpoint Chalie.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staying”
Reviews.Author: sgiasemi
Reviews.Content: We came back a week ago from Berlin. The Novotel Mitte is magnificent ! Very close to 2 Subway stations (5'min walk) and to the magnificent Nikolaikirche area. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was wonderful. The room was spacious, lovely and very quite. Best choice if you travel for holiday in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Bed hard as a rock, location ok, overall fair”
Reviews.Author: austngrl00
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room with sofa for four nights over Christmas. The room was spacious and clean although there was a lack of drawer or shelves for the clothing. (for 2 adults this length of stay). The bathroom is one of those plastic “bathroom-in-a-box kit” things that some hotels have. The bed and pillows were very hard and uncomfortable. We took both comforters and put them on top of the mattress to pad it a bit. There is plenty of parking on site in the garage. The breakfast buffet is very complete and kept stocked the entire time it is open. The staff speaks perfect English and there are many people around if you need assistance. There is one computer available in the lobby for guests but the entire time we were there some parents had dumped their kids there to entertain themselves and play games (very annoying but not the hotel’s fault). No free net in the room. We brought our computer but the hookup fee is outrageous. The closest U Bahn stop (Markisches Museum) is a 10 minute walk and the U2 red line is pretty good for making most connections. We tried the Indian restaurant on the corner there one night (Shezan) It was pretty good. Nikolaiviertel is just 2 blocks away and the Alexanderplatz is also within walking distance. If the weather had been a little nicer, say 8---10 degrees instead of 0 we would have walked most everywhere or rented bikes. Even thought it was cold you can see the great bike paths and you can tell that locals do bike around the city. We did prefer this area to our last stay in the city when we were down by all the shopping near Kurfurstenstrasse. The area we most enjoyed this visit was Hackescher Market and we will try to stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: adzman316
Reviews.Content: We Flew from Stansted to Schönefeld with Ryan air then we had to get to Berlin itself which was very easey indeed The quickest way to get into the city is by taking the RB14 Airport Express Train(use this to get back to the airport too) from platforms 3 or 4 at Berlin Schönefeld Flughafen Station which is an easy six minute walk from the airport terminal. Once at the station you get yourself a travel ticket from the multi lingual machine which will only cost you a few Euro's with plenty of options depending on your stay. It only took us 25 mins to get to Alexanderplatz. Once we arrived we needed a U pass for the underground which was excelent by the way and you pay depending on which zones you want to travel to. This is the best way to get around by far it was so simple. On arrival at Hotel we were swiftly checked in. The only fault i could come up with was that the smoking room we asked for smelt quite strong of smoke ( Yes i might be stating the obvious) That aside it was a very nice clean good sized modern looking room & nice firm bed too. I certainly have a no problem staying here again it was a very nice Hotel. Food & Drinks can be a little on the pricey side but at the time the dire Euro rate wasnt exactly helping matters anywhere we went. Berlin has alot to offer you we went for the xmas markets and they very good. At the same time we done alot of sight seeing like Checkpoint charlie, Berlin wall and Brandenburg gates to name a few.. Also the shops had alot to offer too its a great place to shop but as i said earlier the Euro rate stopped us from shopping unfortunately. Overall i recommend Berlin and the Novotel Berlin Mitte as a recommended stay. People were friendly good things to see and do. We had rain on our first day there but it didnt dampen our spirits thanks Berlin

Reviews.Title: “great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Taxidevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a city break with breakfast included. The quality and choice at breakfast was excellent and really set us up for the day. The hotel was also near many of the Christmas markets we wanted to visit in east Berlin. The location was good and within walking distance of most things. The room was spacious by hotel standards and clean. staff were friendly. We were able to store our luggage after check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: puddey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. We traveled in by public transport from Schonefield and it was really easy. The Ubhan is only minutes away and we used it a lot with our welcome card. This hotel is very clean and modern and has the best soundproofing windows i have ever came across, which is great considering the road outside is very busy.The breakfast is very good but expensive at 16euro so try to get the city break rate that includes the breakfast. Walking distance to the river and Berliner Dom and museum island. Overall a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location great buffet breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: boliston
Reviews.Content: I arrived pretty late about 11pm, and the check in was very quick and I got allocated a room on the top floor which was quite good. I don't speak much German and the staff generally spoke pretty good English. I was at the back of the Hotel which was quite good as there was a view over some gardens towards the canal. There were a few 20 floor tower blocks nearby but not close enough to overlook too much. The front of the Hotel would have been noisier as there is a busy 6 lane highway, so the back suited me as I like to open my window rather than just use the aircon. The Hotel seems built to a good standard with wide hallways and spacious rooms, I think it was built about 5 years ago. I was next to the lift which was handy, but the motor could be faintly heard but not enough to be annoying. I think there were 3 lifts and 3 staircases. The bed seemed comfortable and pretty firm which I prefer. One of the best things was the buffet breakfast which gets served till 10.30am. I ate bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages, fat chips then croissants with jam followed up with fruit salad, but this was only a fraction of what was on offer. My aim was to fill up so that I could get by with just a snack during the day which I managed quite well. There was a handy lobby bar for draft pilsner beer etc, and a restaurant where I tried a pasta dish which was not bad for about 10 Euros. There is a handy supermarket only yards from the entrance where I stocked up on German Cheeses, Sausages breads and deserts for when I wanted to snack in some evenings rather than eat out. The Hotel is only a couple hundred yards from the U Bahn Station and this links to Alexanderplatz for getting the S Bahn to the Airport (EUR 2,80). It cost me EUR 38 for a taxi from the Airport (Schoenfeld) to the Hotel. The checkout time was noon and they have a secure place to store bags which was handy as I had a late flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, convenient price”
Reviews.Author: GGZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and really well situated. I got a very good price for bed&breakfast and the breakfast is one of the best I've been to. Rooms are nice and confortable and staff is always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandJas
Reviews.Content: Hotel mitte is very close to many attractions if you do not mind a short walk. Alexander platz 10-15 minutes, Check point charlie 20 minutes and underground 3 minutes (spittelmarkt). Hotel staff excellent, always someone on the desk who could speak english - Eric and Fabien were very helpful. We were not able to book breakfast as we booked at the last minute - however there is a small mall on the next block which has a bakery. Room was spotless and big enough for three with sofa bed. People very friendly and helpful particularly on underground when trying to purchase tickets. Never felt threatened at all walking to and from hotel to major attractions. Free walking tour starting at starbucks near brandengerg tor - excellent !! Would certainly use this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In A Nice City”
Reviews.Author: odri57
Reviews.Content: A Nice Hotel in a Nice Location in a Nice City

Reviews.Title: “Great design, location and value”
Reviews.Author: MMand
Reviews.Content: This stands out as one of my favourite hotels from numerous trips. Very nice staff, nice restaurant with decent beer selection. Room (upper floor) had fabulous design and decor and was quiet. Location was good, in Mitte, about a 5 minute walk to the subway. Novotel has become one of my favourite hotels - consistently good value, good locations and design.

Reviews.Title: “Good nights sleep but of the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: TravelEndlessly
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and modern. Location wise, the hotel is a little out of the way from the action (probably 10-15 minutes walk) but there is a metro station close by. I would stay there again given the value for money. Berlin was amazing and I would definitely recommend a walking tour.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself with gaufrettes”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: The highlight of the breakfast table in this downtown hotel is a self serving machine for making e.g. maple sirup wafers. But you will find plenty of ham specialities, fruits, cakes too. Friendly, efficient welcome, large perfectly clean rooms, mine was decorated in brown, beige and red. Sauna and fitness center for working out in the basement. Only thjing I missed was a bathrobe. Best feature is location: neighbouring hirstoric Nikolai Quarter, therefore in the sightseeing triangle between Potsdamer Platz, Unter den Linden and Alexanderplatz. The "between" makes some difference in (lower) rates, while the distance is still not more than 3 blocks to Alexanderplatz or 2 min. to U-Bahn station Spittelmarkt. Bus stop for 3 lines around the corner at a small neighbbourhood shopping center with food store, hairderesser and cosy greek restaurant with outdoor garden.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: m0o5e
Reviews.Content: After travelling around Europe for 2 weeks, my family & I arrived at Berlin to visit for 4 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We had managed to obtain a very discounted rate from one of the online websites, so this hotel was considered very comfortable compared to what we had been staying in for the past 2 weeks. The U-bahn station is a mere 2 minute walk across the street - very very convienient especially when compared to the place we had stayed in in Florence; dragging wheeled luggages across crowded uneven streets is no fun. There were also 2 computers in the lobby for use by guests, as well as a video game console (playstation? xbox? i didn't really pay attention) and a Foos ball table. I have no idea whether they were there because of the World Cup last year or if they are permanent, but they were certainly welcomed by my deprived younger siblings.

Reviews.Title: “Bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastguy71
Reviews.Content: Nice 4 star hotel in a fairly quiet neighbourhood away from most of the tourist spots. Whilst internet access in the room is quite expensive EUR19.95 per day, there is a free PC in the lobby, although it can (understandably) get quite busy at times. Breakfast was nothing too special. Subway station is a quick walk from the hotel (Spittelmarkt on the U2 line). There is a small convenience shop hidden away at the back of the hotel (and across the road).

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: despod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family and loved it. The room was large and clena with nice facilities. The breakfast was extensive and the bar/restaurant was reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and indeed dried some of the children's clothers without being asked. Location is good with a U-bahn just 2 minutes walk (or three if the kids are slow). All in all we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: emmandjay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Mitte for 2 nights. It has a good location, although it's on a busy main road. Don't know how noisy this would be for the rooms at the front. There is a tube station about a minute's walk away and the hotel sells day tickets for the transport system, which saves having to use the station vending machines. It is about five minutes walk along the river from the cathedral/Alexanderplatz area. The room was spacious and light with a well equipped bathroom and modern decoration. Everything was clean and tidy. There is an excellent hot and cold breakfast buffet to set you up for the day. Very few people used the hotel restaurant during our stay, but we found the service to be very good and there was a reasonable choice on the menu. The reception staff all spoke perfect English and were pleasant and helpful. A taxi from Schoenefeld cost 28 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMRNorway
Reviews.Content: It's situated in Fiscerinsel, which is close to Nikolai viertel in the part of the city called Mitte. From the airport Schønefeld you have to take the train to Alexanderplatz, and then a taxi or a 1,2 km walk to the hotel(it's easy to find). Once there, the location is perfect for exploring central Berlin, especially the eastern part of the city. Your in walking distance of all the main attractions, like the Museum island, the TV tower, Unter den Linden etc. The western part of Berlin is only a short bus-ride away - the buses stops on Unter den Linden all the time. The hotel room had a nice size, with a sofa(bed) and table and most amenities, and a bath-tub which was excellent after long days of walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - whiffy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and I'll stay here again. The rates are good, the location spot on, the rooms a good size, the staff courteous. As Berlin is so spread out where better place to be than the Mitte ? The buffet breakfast is excellent, and the room service pasta dish is superb (one is enough for two people). Only downside was the mild but obvious pong of drains as I entered the room, which I had to resolve by filling the bath and sink with enough water to cover the plugholes. The shower holder struggled a bit to hold on to the shower, and the sink tap has got to be the most awkward in the world. But bathroom issues aside, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Merd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the Berlin Marathon - which was a lucky choice as it is actually on the course so I could watch the runners without fighting through the crowds. This is a great hotel - spotlessly clean and very modern. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and bathroom has a big bath that you can relax in after a heavy day of shopping or walking. As with other reviewers, I booked directly through the website which is definitely the best option as when we enquired about staying the following weekend, we discovered that the actual price was over double what we paid. Berlin Mitte is a great area to stay in as it close to many things of interest, but if walking is not your thing there is a U-Bahn station about 2 minutes walk from the hotel. I found the public transport in Berlin was very easy to use, but make sure you validate your ticket in the machine if you buy a daily pass.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel; modern, clean, spacious and sleek. Located half-way between Potsdamer Platz and Alexanderplatz served by the frequent M48 Bus Service, get off at Fischer Insel or take the U-bahn, U2 to Spittelmarkt. Rooms are large and pleasant with standard 4 star facilities inc tea, coffee, trouser press, hairdryer etc. Free internet access in the lobby but there's only one terminal and it's usually always occupied. Very nice bathroom, the only downside being the typical Novotel bath/shower fixture which is a bit of a squeeze to get into. Not a problem though, but this was the only thing that prevented me giving a 5 star TripAdvisor rating. Would definitely stay here again as it is an excellent base from which to travel to all areas of Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Fischerinsel 12, 10179 Berlin, Germany
